chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron James LaBonte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Bayfield County 18CF51 and Douglas County 17CF419
Concurrent with: Douglas County 22CF24

superMiscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:40 AM Defendant Cameron James LaBonte in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Cameron James LaBonte.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that in 22CF25, defendant to plead to sole count, 6 years prison fashioned as 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision. Concurrent to 22CF24 but consecutive to Bayfield County 18CF51 and Douglas County 17CF419. Payment of court costs, programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and restitution to remain open for 45 days. Eligible for substance abuse programming and challenge incarceration program. For 22CF24, 3 years prison fashioned as 1.5 years initial confinement and 1.5 years extended supervision. Concurrent to 22CF25 but consecutive to Bayfield County 18CF51 and Douglas County 17CF419. Payment of court costs, programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and restitution to remain open for 45 days. Eligible for both substance abuse programming and challenge incarceration program. Requests 22CM22 is dismissed but read in. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Court reviews with State requests of restitution done by the District Attorney's Office. Attorney Nelsen in agreement. Defendant pleads no contest to each charge. Attorney Nelsen stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes in 22CF25, defendant to plead to sole count, 6 years prison fashioned as 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision. Concurrent to 22CF24 but consecutive to Bayfield County 18CF51 and Douglas County 17CF419. Payment of court costs, programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and restitution to remain open for 45 days. Eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program. For 22CF24, 3 years prison fashioned as 1.5 years initial confinement and 1.5 years extended supervision. Concurrent to 22CF25 but consecutive to Bayfield County 18CF51 and Douglas County 17CF419. Payment of court costs, programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and restitution to remain open for 45 days. Eligible for both substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program. 22CM22 is dismissed but read in.

11:45 AM Defendant Cameron James LaBonte appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Cameron James LaBonte.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes close to resolution. Asks for another status conference with short turnaround. Attorney Nelsen is in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Cameron James LaBonte appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Cameron James LaBonte.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State indicates there has been some communication with Mr. Nelsen. State doesn't object to one more status.
Atty Nelsen indicates there was an offer but wants to discuss this a little more with his client and would like to set for one more Status.
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:23 AM Defendant Cameron James LaBonte appeared by video means with Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen. Defendant Cameron LaBonte in custody. Prosecuting Atty Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF24 and 22CF25, Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Nelsen notes he just received offer from the State and will discuss with defendant next week. Asks for a status in mid April. State has no objection. Court sets status conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:59 AM Defendant Cameron James LaBonte in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Defendant Cameron James LaBonte in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Prelim on 2022CF24
State calls Matthew Brown, s/t
Sergeant for City of Superior Police Department
1/14/22 on duty, reports of males attempting to enter vehicles.
Found individuals and they fled on Missouri Avenue, Superior Douglas County WI.
Witness identifies defendant.   Defendant lowers mask; witness makes affirmative identification
Attorney no response
Record reflects identification of defendant.

Attorney objects-speculation; sustained

Attorney Nelsen cross examines witness

Court questions witness
locations in Douglas county

State final comments
Defense final comments
State rebuttal
Attorney responds

Court finds probable cause, binds over for arraignment.

Preliminary hearing on 2022CF25
State calls-Austin Lauridson, s/t
employed by City of Superior Police Department
1/19/2022 on duty, dispatched to Dominos on Belknap St, Superior Douglas County WI on stolen vehicle report.
Witness identifies defendant.  Does not need defendant to lower mask to make an affirmative identification
Attorney person has already been identified as defendant
Record reflects identification of defendant

Attorney Nelsen no questions for the witness

State final comments
Defense final comments

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment.
Reminds of bail/conditions  Arraignment scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: no contact with victim 1 as listed in the ID Key

01:28 PM Defendant Cameron James LaBonte in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Cameron James LaBonte in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading, enter pleas of not guilty of any misdemeanors and ask for preliminary hearing regarding felony matters. Court will accept plea of not guilty in 22CM22 and set for Status Conference at the same time. Court will set for Preliminary hearing in the other two files. 22CM22 - State requests $2000 cash bond no special conditions. In 22CF25 - State requests $5000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with vicitm 1. In 22CF24 - State requests $5000 cash bond victim Tyler Enisse or the co-defendants of Dominic Thomas, Carson Hanlin, and  Anthony Peterson; other than incidentail contact. Defendant had absconded from extended supervision. Defendant as a short but intense history for a 21 yr old. Defendant comes with three files today. Defendant has a history of resisting with a failure to appear 2018 concealed knife case. 
Atty Hoffman questions Defendant. Defendantis a lifelong resident. Defendant is not currently employed. Defendant is currently on probation and does have a hold on him. Defendant has $1500 he could post. 
Court asserts there are a lot of serious allegations. Court Orders $1000 cash bond in each file. In 22CF24 no contact with Tyler Enisse or the co-defendants of Dominic Thomas, Carson Hanlin, and  Anthony Peterson; other than incidentail contact. In 22CF25 - $1000 cash bond with conditions no contact with victim 1 as listed in the ID Key. Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
